Strengthen policy and technical capacity particularly in the GED; to design and implement pro-poor economic policies; to strengthen capacity for sustainable and inclusive planning; and to monitor the MDGs and develop the post 2015 framework.
capital of a political entity
policy, planning and administration

1. Establishment and operationalization of policy coordination and consultation mechanism in the General Economics Division (Scale 0-4: 4 teams: Core Economic Policy Team (CEPT), Advisory Committee (panel of experts), Civil Society Coordination Team (CSCT) and Inter-ministerial Group (IMG)
2. National 7th five year plan developed (Scale 0-3): 1.Thematic strategies endorsed by the General Economic Division 2. Plan Drafted 3.Plan developed
3. Approval of a guideline on integration of planning approach between local and national levels (Scale 0-2: 1. guideline drafted; 2. guideline approved)
4. Development of and agreement on results-based M&E system for the 7th Five Year Plan through an inclusive process (Scale 0-4): 1. Drafted; 2.Finalized and integrated in 7th national plan document; 3. national action plan developed; 4. national action plan endorsed by government
5. Percentage of participated public planners that use the knowledge and skill gained through project supported training courses on mainstreaming environmental issues into national development plan and programme
6. SDGs implementation plan including national monitoring framework is prepared and implemented
7. A web base data repository system (DevInfo) under General Economic Division (GED) to collate & analyse data, monitoring and reporting on National Development Five Year Plan and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) is established and implemented
8. Economic Policy Analysis Mechanism in the General Economics Division (GED) for projections of macroeconomic, socioeconomic and pro-poor economic policy status and assessment established and functioning.
9. Number of economic early warning (bulletin) generated and shared with concerned ministries and policy makers

comment.narrative: Strengthened capacity of public planners especially GED on strategic planning and initiated major policy reforms and completed upfront works of SDGs. Strengthened results-based M&E framework for monitoring national development plan and SDGs.

This project is aimed at providing support to the justice system through activating village courts in 350 selected Union Parishads (UP) of the country. It also intends to develop capacity of the village court members, elected representatives and support staff. Motivation programme will be carried out in order to sensitize all concerned, on the role and functions of village courts and their benefits on the overall justice system. At the same time it will also address the justice service delivery to marginalized and disadvantaged groups.

A total of 207 UZPs have developed their five-year plan of which 22 in 2016Education, health care, women’s empowerment and poverty issues prioritized. 380355 people directly benefited from 152 schemes where 179087 male and 201268 female. LGD in principle agreed to provide BDT 10 crore (USD 1.29 million) and accordingly directed UZGP to submit the revised DPP, which is now under approval process. Assigned Additional Secretary to review the policy recommendation and prepare a brief report, accordingly draft action items (short-mid-long term) are prepared. comment.narrative: A total of 4464 extreme rural poor women continued their employment in 2016 under SWAPNO. These women were engaged in public asset maintenance, and these jobs helped provide them with a steady and reliable income. This public asset maintenance includes maintaining rural earthen roads to local facilities, maintaining public fields, raising grounds for flood protection, and establishing embankments. As of 2016, all 4464 SWAPNO women benefited from Rotating Savings and Credit Associations (ROSCA), allowing them to generate enough one-time income to invest in other Income Generating Activities (IGAs) to supplement their income and allow them to provide an income for themselves once they exit the SWAPNO project. The 4464 SWAPNO women benefitted from training around maintaining and expanding their chosen Income Generating Activities, which will allow them to provide an income for themselves and dependents for the long-term. The project carried out an economic mapping exercise to guide the small business opportunities for the women. This mapping of market opportunities informed the training plans.

description.narrative: Support to the 11th Parliamentary Election
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Extent to which the Parliament has improved its administrative and human resources capacities required to discharge its mandates in relation to law-making, oversight and representation

Extent to which the Constitution-making body (CMB) has improved its administrative and human resources capacities required to undertake drafting, public outreach and consultation, and ensure the participation of women and marginalized groups

Extent to which capacity of the Electoral Management Body (EMB) to perform its functions, including: financial and operational planning, conducting operations for elections and referenda, voter information and stakeholder outreach to hold credible and inclusive elections, has improved.
Number of registered electors
Number of women participating as candidates in local and national elections supported by UNDP
Support to the 11th Parliamentary Election

title.narrative: Promoting Low Carbon Urban Development in Bangladesh

description.narrative: Promoting Low Carbon Urban Development in Bangladesh

The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project: Promoting Low Carbon Urban Development in Bangladesh. As described in the project identification format (PIF- project concept), this project’s objective is to reduce GHG emission by enabling investments in renewable energy, energy-efficiency and conservation and waste-to-energy applications to support urban development in Bangladesh.
